text: The Prime Minister of Malaysia (; ) is the head of government and the highest political office in Malaysia. The Yang di-Pertuan Agong appoints Prime Minister as a Member of Parliament (MP). The Prime Minister chairs the Cabinet of Malaysia, the de facto executive branch of government. ==List of prime ministers of Malaysia== Colour key (for political coalitions/parties): Portrait Name (Birth–Death) Federal Constituency Term of Office Coalition / Party Duration Tunku Abdul Rahman تونكو عبد الرحمن 31 August 1957He served as the Prime Minister of Malaya from 31 August 1957 until 16 September 1963. 22 September 1970 Alliance Party (UMNO) as the Prime Minister of Malaya from 31 August 1957 until 16 September 1963. 1955, 1959, 1964, 1969 Abdul Razak Hussein عبد الرزاق حسين (Died in office) 22 September 1970 14 January 1976 Alliance Party (UMNO) Barisan Nasional (UMNO) 1974 Hussein Onn حسين عون 15 January 1976 16 July 1981 Barisan Nasional (UMNO) 1978 Mahathir Mohamad محضير محمد 16 July 1981 30 October 2003 Barisan Nasional (UMNO) 1982, 1986, 1990, 1995, 1999 Abdullah Ahmad Badawi عبد الله احمد بداوي 31 October 2003 3 April 2009 Barisan Nasional (UMNO) 2004, 2008 Najib Razak نجيب رزاق 3 April 2009 9 May 2018 Barisan Nasional (UMNO) 2013 Mahathir Mohamad محضير محمد 10 May 2018 24 February 2020 Pakatan Harapan (PPBM) 2018 Muhyiddin Yassin محيي الدين ياسين 1 March 2020 16 August 2021 Perikatan Nasional (PPBM) \- Ismail Sabri Yaakob اسماعيل صبري يعقوب 21 August 2021 24 November 2022 Barisan Nasional (UMNO) \- Anwar Ibrahim انور ابراهيم 24 November 2022 Incumbent Pakatan Harapan (PKR) 2022 ==Notes== ==References== *
title: Prime Minister of Malaysia
